title: Service A Load Balancer Malfunction Causing Traffic Imbalance

symptoms.user_facing: System overloaded - 80% of requests experiencing high latency
monitoring_alerts: Service B CPU and memory utilization > 90%
Service C idle with < 5% resource utilization

root_cause.primary: Service A load balancer configuration bug routing 95% traffic to B path, 5% to C path
root_cause.secondary: Incorrect weight configuration after recent A service deployment

analysis_steps: 1. System-wide performance degradation affecting most users
2. Service B showing extreme load (95% CPU), Service C nearly idle
3. Traffic distribution analysis shows 95:5 ratio instead of expected 60:40
4. Load balancer logs reveal configuration change during last A deployment
6. Found hardcoded weight values overriding dynamic balancing
7. Configuration error introduced in deployment automation
resolution: Corrected load balancer weights, redeployed A service, verified traffic distribution
lessons_learned: Load balancer configurations must be validated before deployment
Implement traffic distribution monitoring and alerting
Automated rollback for routing configuration errors
